alert.note: Alert for Albany; Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 03 at 2:59PM MST until March 03 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Western Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 259 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Iron Mountain to 7 miles west of Cherokee Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 23 and 59. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 321 and 351. Locations impacted include... Chugwater, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, Federal, Tie Siding, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Pumpkin Vine, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Iron Mountain, Granite Springs Campground, Whitaker, Horse Creek, Yellow Pine Campground and The Buttes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
